title: Verified Purchase
content: Spoiler* The first half of the book is TOUGH to get through. It was recommended by a friend and I ended up asking twice if it was worth the struggle. Its a decent story with lots of twists, but with one glaringly obvious clue to the culprit. Victims families always have a point of contact. Someone they interact with for updates, whether it is the investigator themself, or an appointed person. The fact that no one in Nicole's family was working with someone to try to find her was such a big missing piece it made it obvious law enforcement was involved. A couple of unanswered questions by the end and the wrap up seemed a little rushed. But, good enough for a one time read.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on April 21, 2024

title: Great Psychological Thriller.
content: The writer took his time to ensure that all his characters were totally fleshed out and believable.  The author writes very intelligently, and I did enjoy thd twists and turns along the way.  I was able to intuit the ending, however, it could very well be a good surprise twist for some readers.  Even though I guessed the ending and the who-dunnit, the great characters and the plot was well written enough that I still very much enjoyed the ride.  I did notice that going back and forth in time from chapter to chapter did sometimes pull me out of the storyline, sort of slowing down the flow of the book for me.  I would definitely recommend this book to anyone who loves thrillers, with there being a caution that adult themes abound in the novel, and may not be appropriate for very young, or extremely sensitive readers.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 29, 2023

title: 4 stars!
content: What a rollercoaster this story took me on! I love how the story was divided between past and present timelines. It‚Äôs a perfect way to give Nicole a voice even if she‚Äôs missing in the present timeline. I will admit that the beginning of the book dragged a bit because it was more through the lens of Livvie and exploring the job of a medical examiner. It was interesting to read but at times the medical jargon went over my head and got a bit tedious to get through. What this book does superbly is drop so many breadcrumbs that just when you think you‚Äôve got it all figured out another one is thrown your way. I thought I had the book solved midway and boy was I wrong. The ending left me screaming and that‚Äôs all I‚Äôll say about that. First time reading from this author and it definitely won‚Äôt be my last.
post_time: Reviewed in the United States on October 13, 2023
